c-0: ^He’s an art dealer on the side. Perhaps the old man saw something in my work and thought well to fund me to see more of such beauty
^What kind of art do you make?
^It might be difficult for you to understand.
^I’ll have you know I draw a mean stick figure.
c-1: ^You look like you’re trying to convince people that you’re a tortured artist.
^And you look like you’re trying to convince people that you’re an incompetent detective.
^Touche. I’ll step back in my glass house.
c-2: ^I doubt you would understand my work, but I’m a very well known artist.
^That right? My niece loves watching those little cartoons on TV.
^What? No! Not a cartoonist! An artist!
^Ah. Gotcha. Like the person on the boardwalk that draws silly faces.
^I’m not a caricature artist! My name is Vivian O’Blique, and I am a well respected artist that has made works you could never comprehend.
^So can I slip you a ten and you’ll draw me driving a silly car?
^I cost much more than ten measly dollars...
